comments:
The 3.2.x test suite's content type test fails when the used XML parser is the eRCP's microXML. The failing method is the following:

testRootElementAndDTDDescriber(org.eclipse.core.tests.runtime.content.IContentTypeManagerTest) from org.eclipse.core.tests.runtime.content.IContentTypeManagerTest testclass

    testRootElementAndDTDDescriber(org.eclipse.core.tests.runtime.content.IContentTypeManagerTest)
      junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: 3.1 expected:<org.eclipse.core.tests.runtime.dtd> but was:<org.eclipse.core.runtime.xml>
      	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
      	at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:282)
      	at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:64)
      	at org.eclipse.core.tests.runtime.content.IContentTypeManagerTest.testRootElementAndDTDDescriber(IContentTypeManagerTest.java:1196)
      	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
      	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
      	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
      	at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:154)
      	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:127)
      	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
      	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
      	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
      	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
      	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
      	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
      	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
      	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)

The test fails with both 3.2 and 3.3 contenttype.

The problem is that microXML doesn't fire events for DTD elements. I posted this issue some ago in the dsdp-ercp-dev mail list, but I was redirected to the platform group. So here I am.

I wish to note that I'm not using the standard Eclipse way of running the tests. However, I think it should be easy to reproduce the failing by using microXML as the XML parser.

If you need additional info, please ask. I'm not quite sure what information should provide. I hope that this is enough for start.
Content type is is platform core.

> The problem is that microXML doesn't fire events for DTD elements.

Isn't this a bug in "microXML" then? Our tests run fine with the XML parsers bundled in the JRE.

I'm not very sure about the correct action, which should be taken in this situation. Because the problem is indeed in the microXML, I posted this issue in the dsdp-ercp-dev mail list:

http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/dsdp-ercp-dev/msg00039.html

They suggested that I make you aware of this issue. I'm not very involved with the content type bundle, so I cannot help much beyond that.
